metadata.Title: CVE-2021-27365 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.11.3. Certain iSCSIdata structures do not have appropriate length constraints or checks, andcan exceed the PAGE_SIZE value. An unprivileged user can send a Netlinkmessage that is associated with iSCSI, and has a length up to the maximumlength of a Netlink message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27365` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-206.238
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-206.238
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-206.238
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-139.143~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-139.143~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-139.143~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1090.99
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1124.138
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1096.103~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1110.122~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1095.108~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1067.75~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1148-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1148.158
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1152-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1152.162
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-206.238').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-139.143~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1090.99').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1124.138').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1096.103~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1110.122~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1095.108~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1067.75~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1148.158').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1152.162').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
